definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: The guys and gals holding poses often have dramatic looks and body types.
sentences.chinese: 男女模特常常有惊艳的外表和身材。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, in the butterfly hall, visitors marvel at the beautiful insects.
sentences.chinese: 同时在蝴蝶厅里，访客为这美丽的昆虫所惊艳。

sentences.english: Clouds want to cover the fabulous sun.
sentences.chinese: 云朵想要遮蔽那轮惊艳的太阳。

sentences.english: They are covered in clear crystal pavé and reflect the light in magical ways.
sentences.chinese: 密镶透明水晶，反射着另人惊艳的光芒。

sentences.english: Amazing camera work in this video.
sentences.chinese: 这段视频简直是令人惊艳的摄像作品。

sentences.english: As a performer, Mr. Curtis drew on his startlingly good looks.
sentences.chinese: 作为表演者，柯蒂斯惊艳的英俊外貌可谓得天独厚。

sentences.english: It was worth it to get such amazing photos though.
sentences.chinese: 即使这样，我还是觉得拍摄这张惊艳的照片是值得的。

sentences.english: Black tea is bracing, strong, and tastes wonderful with a little honey and milk.
sentences.chinese: 红茶茶味很足，搭配一点牛奶和蜂蜜更是惊艳。

sentences.english: "FU-GUI Tea Cup Set", an amazing meeting, an eternal collection.
sentences.chinese: 让人惊艳的相遇，永恒的收藏。

sentences.english: She is amazingly beautiful in that red dress.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着那件红色洋装时，美得今人惊艳。

sentences.english: Who else could pull off this stunning ensemble?
sentences.chinese: 还有谁能脱掉这套惊艳的礼服？

sentences.english: Taiwan's Cloud Gate dance group puts on magnificent performances.
sentences.chinese: 台湾舞团《云门舞集》的表演令人惊艳。

definition: warms the heart and delights the eye (idiom)/pleasing/delightful
a pleasant change/a breath of fresh air/refreshing
visually attractive/eye candy/easy on the eyes/to protect the eyes
